reviewText:
So I have a decent computer and I have to turn the settings down a bit to run this game. The game sometimes locks for a couple seconds in between turns. However, this is a good game I would still highly recommend it. A lot of the negative reviews are people that were somehow unaware that this is an RNG based game and are frustrated, complain about the timers, or are upset about optimization issues.

Maybe I'm insane, but if a game is a bit buggy at launch, but still works I don't just take to the internet to write a scathing day-one review about how I had to turn AA off. Some people's reviews are understandable to where the game did not launch or something or were met with frequent crashes. I get that. I just hate it when people drop a negetive review because of optimisation problems then never bother to change it and artifically drop the rating. If your game didn't work. that's cool. If you couldn't run it on triple-ultra settings with smell-o-vision turned on, then didn't bother to play the game, then give it a negative review, please just don't leave one until you've played the game. Maybe I'm just a butt-hurt fanboy, but I've noticed how a lot more people seem to place flawless optimization over gameplay, which drives me insane.

People keep complaining about the timers on some missions, but the reviews seem to misrepresent the entire game as having timers on every mission. Optional missions often have timers associated with them, but people often leave out how you can use a drone to remote hack into several objectives and stop the timer. Major missions and many difficult missions do not have a timer assoicated with them. You can also back out of a mission if it gets to hot or you can savescum through most of them pretty easily. The game is meant to be difficult and people talk about the timers as if having a time limit somehow doesn't make it a strategy game.

Also, yes, this is an RNG based game. The computer doesn't always fight fair, your soldiers will die, and bad things will happen. Your choices in research priorities, side missions, and dark events will change the outcome of the game later on for better or for worse. You are fighting an alien threat far more advanced than yourself, thus the difficulty curve is supposed to be high. You don't have hardened space maries, a secret weapon, or super powers. What you have is a stolen space ship, a scientist, an engineer, and some guys with guns. This game is hard, but you can always learn the game by playing on easy and saving frequently. If you don't like things there are already a ♥♥♥♥-ton of mods that tweak the game to different playstyles.

Anyway, tl;dr:
-This game is hard, so try savescumming and playing on easy to get the hang of it
-There's RNG
-There are timers, but not on all missions and sometimes there are ways to stop them, and retreating is always an option
-There are optimisation problems, but it's playable and at the most inconvient for most people
-There are mods that can tweak the game to your play style
-The game is hard. It's supposed to be hard.
-It's a good game and worth playing.

I give it now a positive review, after finishing the game in normal difficulty, because this is simply put the best Xcom so far. Why? I will try to summarize:

1. Put a much intense emphasis on the story compared with the ones before.
2. It's full of beautiful cinematics
3. It's much more streamlined but without letting it be oversimplified, decisions can still be tough and meaninful, but not confusing. It follows however a much logical progression
4. The game gives a much bigger impression of difficulty without actually being so (in normal difficulty)
5. It's just beautiful, even in minimum settings, you fall inmersed on this universe, and not even talking about the HUGE personalization options.
6. The characters have much more charisma, and the soldiers are so much personalizable, making you care much more about them
7. The abilities of both the soldiers and the enemies are all hugely useful. No more abilities that you will never use. And they all just feel right and powerful, leveling up your soldiers is incredible satisfiying. The new psyonic class is just great.
8. More randomized everything. Decisions, Technology, Maps, Abilities effect... But nevertheless, less confusion.
9. New mechanics, such as stealth, are really well implemented and works wonders. I've done many allien bases assaults with Very difficult setting, and about 20 enemies including Sectopods, Chryssalids and whatnot, without shooting a single rifle, and a crew of just 3 thanks to this new ability. Not easy, but definitly doable.
10. Modability. Firaxis learnt the lesson and listened to its clients. Now accepts mods and even has its own public modding tools you can download and create your own mods, maps, etc. Or share your customized soldiers with whoever you want.

Hugely recommended and worth your money

TL;DR: Buy it, it's gud.

Edit 2:
Multiplayer at the moment sucks! The delay between turns and the amount of bugs is totally unbearable, truly needs to be fixed soon...

reviewText:
First of all, excuse my bad english and spelling, I am however not english, so please bear with me.

At first I was very hesitant to buy this game due to the following 4 reasons:
1 - I was not sure if my Geforce GT 740m could run this.
2 - I read about the terrifying mission timers.
3 - I read about the performance issues and glitches.
4 - I read about the terrifying Avatar Project.

Well, I took the leap of faith and bought it, thinking I could refund it if any of my nightmares become true. This however - was not the case. Let me explain what happend to m above-mentioned points:
1 - My laptop can run this game 100%, even given the fact that my graphics card is a bit below the recommended specs. Albeit I play on all the minimum settings, honostly the graphics are really still amazing and more that satisfying to look at. It may be a bit personal opinion as I play a game more for the gameplay (which is soooo so so good), rather than the graphics, but even so...I am really impressed with how great this game still looks even on lowest settings.
2 - The mission timers, in one word, they are awesome !! I read a lot of people complain, saying it takes tactics aways, makes you stress, ensures you can't play the game like you normally would etc etc, and although I was also not keen on mission timers as I also like to not feel rushed, take my time with overwatching enemies and so forth, mission timers are a great addition. It creates a sense of urgency, while making you stress yes, but in a good..and fun way. It most certainly does not take away tactics, and if you feel it does, it replaces it with other tactics. When your country/earth gets invaded, you have to play by their rules, and these timers mould into this theme brilliantly. I mean for example...if they want to execute someone, they are going to execute them..and it's up to you to save the person if you have what it takes. If not, they won that mini battle, but you can retaliate in other ways. So again - do not be afraid of the negative reviews saying mission timers spoil the game, they don't, and if you truely feel they do, there's mods to extend the timers or completely remove them.
3 - Performance issues...well honostly, there is a few, but NOTHING game breaking at all. Yes sometimes you wait 10sec for enemies to make their move, or sometimes you struggle for a bit to see the middle floor of a building, but this, for me at least, does not take anything away from the other 99% of bugfree amazing gameplay. Performance issues and fps drops, I have not encountered them, even on my sub par setup. In my 11hours I've had 1 time where my fps dropped noticebly for 2sec, that is ALL. In al honostly, I can live with that if I get a great game like this in return.
4 - Ahhhh the Avatar Project aka the doomsday tracker. Again..same as my second point, there is ways to stall this timer". Honostly if you make sure you expand early on and play very slowly and carefully
date: I can't see why this will ever be an issue....and if you REALLY don't want this tracker..again
